summary: The Security Council reaffirmed its commitment to the sovereignty and territorial integrity of the Republic of Tajikistan and welcomed the positive outcome of the meeting between the President of the Republic of Tajikistan and the leader of the Islamic Revival Movement of Tajikistan. The Council extended the mandate of the United Nations Mission of Observers in Tajikistan (UNMOT) until 15 December 1995, requested the Secretary-General to continue to pursue efforts to speed up the progress towards national reconciliation, and called upon the parties to cooperate fully with UNMOT and to achieve a comprehensive political settlement of the conflict. The Council also welcomed the decision of the Council of the Heads of State of the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS) to extend the mandate of the CIS Collective Peace-keeping Forces in Tajikistan until 31 December 1995.
title: S/RES/999(1995)
